info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:11PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mississippi, north central Tipton and southwestern Lauderdale Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 611 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Luxora, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Covington, Osceola, Luxora, Fort Pillow State Park, Burdette, Ashport, Ft Pillow, Garland, O`Donnell Bend, Tomato, Moran, Bride, Tuckertown, Rosa, Golddust, Luckett, Three Point, Chilson, Keyes Port and Lightfoot. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and west Tennessee.
